We must continue to work on improving the ACA, not abandon it. I am committed to ensuring that Americans have access to affordable, quality care. 5/5

The ACA has shortcomings that need to be fixed, but one provision that must remain is the protection of individuals with #preexistingconditions. Our legislation would have kept that provision while simultaneously making improvements that could lower premiums up to 30%. 4/5

My colleagues and I in the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus came up with a solution last Congress to address this by creating a "dedicated stability fund" that states could use to cut premium costs, especially for those with pre-existing conditions. 3/5

Experts attribute the decline in part to actions by the Trump administration to undermine the #ACA, including the decision to eliminate ‚Äúcost share reduction‚Äù payments. This has put the cost of ACA policies out of reach for middle class Americans not receiving a subsidy. 2/5
